SEARCH
Package cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing

Class PenSettings

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.PenSettings
public class PenSettings extends Object
A class representing the settings used for configuring the appearance of a Pen implementation.

This class holds the configuration for the pen's color, background color, and stroke width. It provides a method to apply these settings to a Graphics2D object.

Individual pens may choose to use or ignore any of these settings as needed for their specific functioning.

See Also:

  • ShapePen

  • Field Details

    • mainColor

      public Color mainColor
      The color to be used for drawing with the pen.

      Common usage includes he stroke color of pens and outline color of shapes

    • backgroundColor

      public Color backgroundColor
      The color to be used for the background.

      Common usage includes the fill color of shapes.

    • strokeWidth

      public int strokeWidth
      The stroke width to be used for the pen.

      Common usage also includes the width of shape outlines

  • Constructor Details

    • PenSettings

      public PenSettings()
      Creates a PenSettings object with default values:
      • Main color: Color.BLACK
      • Background color: Color.WHITE
      • Stroke width: 1

    • PenSettings

      public PenSettings(Color mainColor, Color backgroundColor, int strokeWidth)
      Creates a PenSettings object with the specified values.
      Parameters:
      mainColor - he color to be used for drawing with the pen
      backgroundColor - he color to be used for the background and fill
      strokeWidth - the stroke width to be used for the pen

  • Method Details

    • setupGraphics2D

      public void setupGraphics2D(Graphics2D g)
      Configures the specified Graphics2D object using the settings of this PenSettings.

      This method sets the color and stroke of the Graphics2D object to match the pen's settings. Specifically, it sets the color to mainColor and the stroke to a BasicStroke with the specified strokeWidth, rounded caps, and miter join.

      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics2D object to configure
